hudson.model
Class Hudson

java.lang.Object
  hudson.model.AbstractModelObject
      hudson.model.View
          hudson.model.Hudson
All Implemented Interfaces:
ItemGroup<TopLevelItem>, ModelObject, Node, PersistenceRoot
public final class Hudson
extends View
implements ItemGroup<TopLevelItem>, Node

Root object of the system.

Author:
Kohsuke Kawaguchi

Description copied from interface: ItemGroup
Gets the URL token that prefixes the URLs for child Items. Like "job", "item", etc.

Specified by:
getUrlChildPrefix in interface ItemGroup<TopLevelItem>

getRootUrl

public java.lang.String getRootUrl()
Gets the absolute URL of Hudson, such as "http://localhost/hudson/".

Also note that when serving user requests from HTTP, you should always use HttpServletRequest to determine the full URL, instead of using this (this is because one host may have multiple names, and HttpServletRequest accurately represents what the current user used.)

This information is rather only meant to be useful for sending out messages via non-HTTP channels, like SMTP or IRC, with a link back to Hudson website.

Returns:
This method returns null if this parameter is not configured by the user. The caller must gracefully deal with this situation. The returned URL will always have the trailing '/'.
Since:
1.66

getRootDir

public java.io.File getRootDir()
Description copied from interface: PersistenceRoot
Gets the root directory on the file system that this Item can use freely fore storing the configuration data.

This parameter is given by the ItemGroup when Item is loaded from memory.

Specified by:
getRootDir in interface PersistenceRoot

getWorkspaceFor

public FilePath getWorkspaceFor(TopLevelItem item)

Returns a "workspace" directory for the given TopLevelItem.

Workspace directory is usually used for keeping out the checked out source code, but it can be used for anything.

public boolean isQuietingDown()
Returns true if Hudson is quieting down.

No further jobs will be executed unless it can be finished while other current pending builds are still in progress.

getItemByFullName

public <T extends Item> T getItemByFullName(java.lang.String fullName,
                                            java.lang.Class<T> type)
Gets the Item object by its full name. Full names are like path names, where each name of Item is combined by '/'.

Returns:
null if either such Item doesn't exist under the given full name, or it exists but it's no an instance of the given type.

getAllCvsRoots

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllCvsRoots()
Returns all CVSROOT strings used in the current Hudson installation.

Ideally this shouldn't be defined in here but EL doesn't provide a convenient way of invoking a static function, so I'm putting it here for now.
